jobs.title: Sr Principal Engineer, Mechanical Engineering
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are seeking a highly experienced engineer to serve as our Mechanical Engineering Lead whose scope will include Precision Motion, Precision Machine Design, and Automation Systems.

In this role, the Mechanical Engineering Lead will drive architecture evaluation, develop detailed product design and characterization metrology. Responsibilities also include integrating hardware with software and firmware, debugging the system, optimizing the design for robust, reliable operation, and verifying sub-system performance.

The ideal candidate will be a highly cross-functional engineer, skilled at managing other designers and vendor-partners. The candidate must be a highly effective communicator, speaking the language of optical, mechanical, electrical, and software/firmware partners. The ideal candidate is curious and a fast learner, unintimidated by climbing steep new learning curves and going deep into the details of a new technology.

Key Responsibilities

  • Establish clear requirements for the Mechanical Sub-Systems, collaborating closely with cross-functional stakeholders.

  • Drive key architecture decisions for Precision Motion, Precision Machine Design, and Automation Systems.

  • Serve as the highest-level owner of the detailed design of the Mechanical Sub-Systems, establishing clear specifications for the hardware and operational workflow that enable robust, reliable operation.

  • Own the integration and bring-up of the Mechanical Sub-Systems including hardware, software, and firmware integration. This includes supporting the development of detailed definitions of operational workflows, including exceptions and error handling.

  • Develop metrology to measure the performance of the Mechanical Sub-Systems.

  • Own the Engineering Verification Testing demonstrating that sub-system requirements are met.

  • Lead Tiger Teams, as necessary, to debug the most complex issues.

  • Contribute to the company’s intellectual property, especially in selecting optimal system architectures.

Qualifications

Required:

  • Advanced degree (MS or Ph.D.) in Mechanical Engineering, Applied Physics, or a related field.

  • 15+ years of leadership experience in complex instrument development within life sciences, semiconductor, diagnostics, or imaging systems.

  • Deep technical expertise in mechanical engineering, with specific experience developing precision motion systems and precision mechanisms.

  • Strong track record of effective collaboration across cross-functional disciplines through effective communication and first-order modeling.

Preferred:

  • Experience with automated optical or biochemical instruments for molecular diagnostics or high-throughput screening.

  • Familiarity with regulatory and quality considerations for life science instruments.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We thrive on diversity and collaboration.

jobs.title: Fluidics Test Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
As a Fluidics Test Engineer, your test results will be critical to understand the performance of our products and will drive the direction of the architecture. You will be a key member of the core engineering team responsible for delivering our flagship product.

Key Responsibilities

  • Prototype Test Fixtures – Build, integrate, and optimize fluidic test stations including mechanical assembly, wiring, basic FW/SW development. Select metrology for key fluidic metrics, integrate into fixtures, and characterize sensor performance.

  • Design Tests and Automation – Design and execute experiments to characterize key fluidics parameters and verify performance of fluidics systems. Develop hardware and scripts (python, LabView, etc) to automate tests.

  • Data Analysis – Analyze data using statistical methods and software tools (t-tests, ANOVA, GR&R, statistical process control, JMP, log parsing).

  • Debug – Investigate data outliers and test failures to identify the root cause of noise sources, errors, and conflicting results using troubleshooting techniques (fishbone, 5 why, is/is-not, 8 Ds). Recommend and implement improvements to test methods, hardware, and analysis.

  • Communication – Present findings and recommendations to the broader team in the form of presentations and test reports. Clearly communicate results to the design team to address issues with performance, quality, and reliability.

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s +2 years experience, or Master’s in mechanical engineering, bioengineering, physics, or a related field.

  • 1+ years of experience with fluidics design and metrology

  • 3D CAD design experience with Solidworks, or similar

  • Fabrication (milling, drilling, mechanical assembly, fluidics assembly, cable assembly)

  • Basic electronics knowledge (microcontrollers, motor drivers)

  • Script development for hardware interfaces (python, Matlab, LabView)

  • Data analysis tools (SQL, JMP, MiniTab, log parsing, python)

We are an equal opportunity employer. We thrive on diversity and collaboration.

jobs.title: Sr. Staff Engineer, Mechanical Engineering / Fluidics
jobs.descriptionHtml:
In this role as a Sr Staff Mechanical Engineer, you’ll drive the architecture and delivery of primary modules of our fluidics automation system including reagent storage and delivery, thermal control systems, and part handling automation. You will be a key member of the core engineering team responsible for defining and delivering our flagship platform.

Key Responsibilities

  • System Architecture: Define requirements, error budgets, tolerance stacks, specifications and execute trade studies to define the architecture for our fluidic system, optimizing performance, cost, manufacturability, and reliability.

  • Design & Development

    • Lead the design and implementation of complex assemblies using CAD and simulation tools.

    • Develop and validate mechanisms for liquid handling, reagent storage, and thermal management.

    • Define component interfaces and tolerances across mechanical, electrical, and fluidic domains.

    • Select & integrate components: Pumps, valves, pressure sensors, seals, bearings, encoders, drives, heaters, thermoelectrics, temperature sensors, materials

  • Cross-Functional Integration

    • Collaborate closely with systems, electrical, and software engineers to align mechanical and control architectures.

    • Partner with assay scientists to ensure mechanical designs meet biological and chemical requirements.

    • Work with operations, manufacturing, and supply chain to ensure scalability, cost-efficiency, and high-quality builds.

  • Prototyping, Testing & Validation

    • Lead prototype builds and iterative design improvements based on empirical test results.

    • Define and execute mechanical and system-level verification and validation plans.

    • Analyze performance data and reliability metrics to drive continuous improvement.

Qualifications

Required:

  • BS/MS in Mechanical Engineering (or related) and 10–15+ years designing fluidic / mechanical systems for production instruments or machines.

  • Demonstrated ownership of complex electromechanical systems from concept through launch.

  • Expert 3D CAD (SolidWorks); drawings with GD&T.

  • Deep expertise in one or more of the following:

    • Reagent storage and delivery – materials, mfg methods, reagent sensitivities

    • Fluidics and reagent handling systems (pumps, valves, manifolds, sensors)

    • Thermal management and temperature control (heaters, TECs, thermal cycling)

    • Precision motion systems or part handling automation

    • Strong analytical and modeling skills — both mechanical and thermal.

Preferred:

  • Experience in bioinstrumentation, analytical devices, or medical instruments

  • Working knowledge of embedded controls, sensors, and mechatronic integration.

  • Experience mentoring other engineers and influencing design culture.

We are an equal opportunity employer. We thrive on diversity and collaboration.
